column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: The temperature {{c1::has risen}} (rise). It's much warmer now.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: I'm looking for Ben. {{c1::Have you seen}} (you / see) him anywhere?

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: I {{c1::haven't told}} (not / tell) anybody that you're coming to see us, so nobody knows.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: Is the meeting still going on, or {{c1::has it finished}} (it / finished)?

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: Maria's English {{c1::has improved}} (improve) a lot. It's much better than it was.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: It was a great film, but {{c1::I have forgotten|I've forgotten}} (I / forget) the name.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: I sent Sarah an email yesterday, but she {{c1::has not replied|hasn't replied}} (not / reply).

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3: You {{c1::haven't signed}} (not / sign) the letter. Could you please sign it now?

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Are you hungry?
B: Yes, {{c1::I haven't eaten|I have not eaten}} (I / not / eat) much today.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Do you like caviar?
B: I don't know. {{c1::I've never tried|I have never tried}} (I / never / try) it.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Are you enjoying your holiday?
B: Yes, it's the best holiday {{c1::I've had|I have had}} (I / have) for a long time.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: What's that book about?
B: I don't know. {{c1::I haven't read|I have not read}} (I / not / read) it.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Is Brussels an interesting place?
B: I have no idea. {{c1::I haven't been|I have not been|I've not been}} (I / not / be) there.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: I hear your car broke down yesterday.
B: Yes, it's the second time {{c1::it's happened|it has happened}} (it / happen) this month.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Can you play chess?
B: Yes, but {{c1::I haven't played|I have not played}} (I / not / play) for ages.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Mark was late for work again today.
B: Again? {{c1::He's been|He has been}} (He / be) late every day this week.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form (present perfect).
column3:
A: Who's that woman standing by the door?
B: I don't know. {{c1::I've never seen|I have never seen}} (I / never / see) her before.
